data.title: Wisconsin Alumni Research Foundation
data.meta_description: The Discovery Building connects UW Madison research with the community to explore emerging technology and innovative ideas through lectures and field trips.
data.text:
EXPLORE. ENGAGE. DISCOVER.

The Discovery Building was completed in 2010, marking a new chapter in WARFâ€™s long tradition of supporting the UW-Madison campus.

The first floor of the building, the Town Center, was designed as a central space where campus, community and industry could gather and discover more about the research and innovation that takes place at UW-Madison. Visitors to the Town Center can host their own event, participate in a variety of programs or enjoy a meal. WARF and our campus partners host many programs throughout the year, including lectures, demonstrations and field trips that bring the wider Wisconsin community onto campus.

The Discovery Building is also home to twin research institutes, the private Morgridge Institute for Research and the public Wisconsin Institute for Discovery. Their private-public collaboration helps facilitate breakthrough discoveries to advance health and well-being.

Plan your visit to the Discovery Building

Reserve a space at the Discovery Building

Offering inspiring spaces for rent by the campus and community. The building can accommodate expos, lectures, meetings, weddings and more.

VISIT THE UW CONFERENCES & EVENTS SITE TO VIEW RESERVABLE SPACES

Programs for campus & community members

The Wisconsin Institutes for Discovery, known as the Discovery Building, is home to many programs that highlight science and creativity for campus and community members.

VIEW WARF PROGRAMS

VIEW MORGRIDGE INSTITUTE PROGRAMS

VIEW WID EVENTS

Building donors

A generous gift from UW-Madison alumni John and Tashia Morgridge started the project. The state of Wisconsin and WARF also contributed initial funding. Two-thirds of the building is privately owned by WARF and the other third is publicly owned by UW-Madison.

Contact the Discovery Building
